PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Gelasio Benedetto Anatolio Caetani Papers)//EN" "caetanig.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the Gelasio Benedetto Anatolio Caetani Papers, 1906-1934
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2000 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, photographs, and clippings, relating to Italy in World War I, Italian-American relations, and Herbert Hoover.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Gelasio Benedetto Anatolio Caetani Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Italian mining engineer and diplomat; ambassador to the United States, 1922-1925.

did.unittitle: Copies of a small group of letters exchanged between Herbert Hoover and Gelasio Caetani, 1912-1913
Letters to and copies of letters from Gelasio Caetani, 1922-1925, mostly pertaining to his career as Italian Ambassador to the United States
Letters from Gelasio Caetani to Albert Burch, 1914-1934, many pertaining to Gelasio Caetani's World War I experiences; and copies of letters from Albert Burch to Gelasio Caetani
Letters from Gelasio Caetani to James Batcheller, 1916 and 1932-1934
Manuscripts, speeches, magazines articles by or concerning Gelasio Caetani, 1923-1925
Five volumes containing clippings, pictures, etc., 1923-1925, pertaining mostly to Gelasio Gaetani's post as Italian Ambassador to the United States
Reports of mines in Arizona, Nicaragua, Mexico, Idaho, Colorado, 1906-1914, with some correspondence
A report on the mines of the Austin-Manhattan consolidated Co., by Gelasio Caetani, 1910
Miscellaneous clippings, photographs, and memorabilia pertaining to Gelasio Caetani
Memorial testament, 1934, to Gelasio Caetani from the San Francisco section of the American Institute of Mining and Metallurgical Engineers
